name: Frances Ellen Watkins Harper
bio: Frances Ellen Watkins Harper (1825â€“1911) was a pioneering Black poet, novelist, and activist. A gifted speaker and educator, she was a key figure in 19th-century abolitionist and suffragist movements. She was one of the first Black women to publish a novel in the U.S. and was widely read across Black and white audiences.
quote: We are all bound up together in one great bundle of humanity.

sources.title: Frances Ellen Watkins Harper: Black Daughter of the Revolution
sources.author: Melba Joyce Boyd

sources.title: Harper Collection at Documenting the American South
